results.title: Duty free
results.creator_credit: Dennis Sawyer, ONF | NFB and F Whitman Trecartin
results.brief_description: A colorful, rollicking account of Nova Scotia’s rum-running days, told in part by mariners who made the runs into forbidden American ports some fifty years ago, and in part by re-enactments of their tales by actors. The sources of their profitable illegal cargoes were the French islands of St. Pierre and Miquelon, quiet enough now, but once busy rendezvous for smugglers.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dennis Sawyer, ONF | NFB and F Whitman Trecartin

results.title: Dutch Pirates Are Heroes
results.creator_credit: Joy Barrow, David E. Barrow and Barinder Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode number 10 of Series “A World of Festivals”.
Every April, in the Dutch city of Brielle, the community holds a festival of dance, wine and song to commemorate the 1572 victory of Flemish pirates and beggars over the invading Spanish ships. The festival involves a procession through the main square and a re-creation of the battle between the pirates and the Spanish sailors.

results.title: Dutch oven cooking
results.brief_description: Illustrates the basic principles of fire building and Dutch oven cooking for hikers and campers. Emphasizes the care and precision which must be exercised when sharpening and using axes and knives; demonstrates the correct methods for chopping wood. Describes, step by step, the procedure for making a batch of biscuits including the preparation of the Dutch oven for baking.

results.title: Dusty (Captioned)
results.brief_description: Dusty is a film that will captivate with its values of love, loyalty and the quest for freedom. Based on the classic Australian book by Frank Dalby Davison, this is the story of an ill-fated bond between an old man and his dog. Tom Lincoln, an ageing drover, buys Dusty in a hotel, unaware that the dog is part kelpie and part dingo. He trains Dusty into a champion sheep dog but becomes aware his dog has the killer in his blood. Finally he returns to the bush, set apart from the world by his love for his dog. Rated: G

results.title: Dustbins in the sky
results.creator_credit: Bob Thorpe, London Television Service and Mike Lockey
results.brief_description: Made for the television program “Perspective”, this documentary examined the growth of technology in the collection, transmission and dissemination of news, from early cinema newsreels to today’s satellite coverage.

results.title: Dust to dust
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a small town in northern NSW and the effects of asbestos mining there. The people estimate that three-quarters of the workers have died or are sick from exposure to asbestos. In presenting their story the film raises issues regarding occupational health in general.

results.title: During that time
results.brief_description: This humourous 2D hand-drawn animation is also a hard-luck story of a man locked in a fortified jail in the middle of the ocean. He receives instructions on how to escape and sets about to dig himself out. Bearing a strong resemblance to the animated character, Mr. Garrison from Southpark, the prisoner crawls through his tunnel to find he’s landed on a deserted and barren island and is no better off, a possible play on the plot-line of Pappillon.

results.title: Durga puja in Calcutta
results.creator_credit: Calcutta Film Society and Mriganka Sekhar Ray
results.brief_description: The monsoon is over…in Bengal it is time for the festival of Durga Puja, goddess of war, militant aspect of Parvati, consort of Shiva. Celebrations praise Durga’s victory over the buffalo demon Mahisasura symbolising triumph of good over evil. The film is an impressionistic view of this festival.

results.title: Durer and the renaissance
results.brief_description: Part of the Art History series, describes the life and work of Albrecht Durer, German painter and engraver, and his part in connecting the artistic development in Italy with that of northern Europe.
